title: 104_hr1114
content: AUTHORITY FOR 16- AND 17-YEAR-OLDS TO LOAD MATERIALS INTO SCRAP PAPER BALERS AND PAPER BOX COMPACTORS. The Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 is amended to allow 16- and 17-year-old employees to load materials into scrap paper balers and paper box compactors that meet safety standards. The Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 is amended to allow 16- and 17-year-old employees to operate scrap paper balers and paper box compactors that meet safety standards set by the American National Standards Institute, including the use of an on-off switch with key-lock control by employees aged 18 or older. The Fair Labor Standards Act allows 16- and 17-year-old employees to operate scrap paper balers and paper box compactors that meet safety standards. Employers must ensure the equipment is maintained properly and provide notice that only loading is allowed for young employees. Additionally, any injury to an employee under 18 from contact with the equipment must be reported to the Secretary. Employers must report injuries or fatalities of employees under 18 involving scrap paper balers or paper box compactors to the Secretary for safety monitoring purposes. The reports should include employer and employee details, as well as the incident location. Employers must promptly report injuries or fatalities of employees under 18 involving scrap paper balers or paper box compactors to the Secretary. Reports should include details of the incident, employer, employee, date, injury description, and equipment involved. The Secretary cannot solely rely on these reports to determine violations of child labor laws and must conduct further investigation. The Secretary must conduct an investigation before determining if employers have violated child labor laws, even if they have reported injuries or fatalities involving young employees. Reporting requirements expire 2 years after enactment. SEC. 2. CIVIL MONEY PENALTY. Amends the Fair Labor Standards Act to include penalties for violations. SEC. 3. CONSTRUCTION. Clarifies that certain exemptions for apprentices and student learners remain unaffected.
